title: Regenerate Portfolio Project Images (12 per project) in a New Human-Designed Style

requirements.text: Generate fully new, professional, human-designed-looking portfolio images for each of the 10 existing portfolio projects, producing exactly 12 images per project (120 total), and save them as static assets under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` using the new filenames specified in this build request.

quotes: i want to every porfolio topic design professional as though it look like by a human work. yes i want me to regenerate new professional portfolio images for your 10 projects.redesigned which look by human wook.
No i want all 10 portfolio projects to receive fully new human work professional design.Should each project have multiple images again by looks human work.
12,want a different style for the new humanâ€‘work look?

acceptanceCriteria: There are exactly 120 new image files present under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` with the exact filenames listed in `imageRequirements.required`.
Each of the 10 projects has exactly 12 images available (not fewer, not more).
All newly generated images follow a consistent, professional, human-designed visual style (different from the previous corporate/gradient/mockup style).

requirements.text: Update `frontend/src/data/projects.ts` so each of the 10 existing project entries keeps its current title/description/category/tools/link unchanged, but replaces its `images` list so it contains exactly 12 image objects (`src`, `alt`) that reference the new generated portfolio image asset paths (absolute `/assets/generated/...`) and include non-empty English alt text for every image.
acceptanceCriteria: In `frontend/src/data/projects.ts`, each of the 10 project objects has an `images` array with length exactly 12.
Every `images[i].src` is an absolute path starting with `/assets/generated/` and matches a real file shipped in `frontend/public/assets/generated/`.
Every `images[i].alt` is present, non-empty, and written in English.
Project `title`, `description`, `category`, `tools`, and `link` values remain unchanged from the current version.

requirements.text: Ensure the Portfolio UI gallery continues to render multiple images per project without broken/blank image areas by keeping production-safe image loading behavior (normalize image paths and fall back to `getFallbackImagePath()` on error), and update the thumbnail rendering to use a non-cropping fit behavior so thumbnails do not cut off the sides of the portfolio images.

quotes: i want to every porfolio topic design professional as though it look like by a human work.

acceptanceCriteria: On the Portfolio page, each project card gallery can navigate through all 12 images (next/previous and thumbnail selection) without console errors.
If any portfolio image fails to load, the UI swaps to the fallback image via the existing `onError` behavior rather than showing a broken/blank image area.
Portfolio thumbnails do not crop/cut off image content on the sides; they use a non-cropping fit behavior (e.g., `object-contain`) while remaining visually clean and consistent.

constraints: Do not change the backend (Motoko) actor, schema, or contact submission storage as part of this request.

Do not modify `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, or any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (immutable paths).
Keep the existing 10 portfolio projects (title/description/category/tools/link) unchanged; only replace their image sets and related image rendering behavior.
All portfolio image `src` values must be absolute paths (start with `/assets/...`) and resolve to real static files shipped in production under `frontend/public/assets/generated/`.
User-facing text added/changed by this request (e.g., alt text, aria labels if adjusted) must be in English.
nonGoals: Do not redesign the overall Portfolio page layout, filtering, or project text content beyond what is required to support the new images.
Do not add new portfolio projects or remove existing ones.
Do not add any backend-driven image serving or store images in the backend.
Do not change Blog images/routes/content as part of this request.
